[Home](./index.md) &gt; [@here/harp-mapview](./harp-mapview.md) &gt; [Tile](./harp-mapview.tile.md)

## Tile class

The class that holds the tiled data for a \[\[DataSource\]\].

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare class Tile implements CachedResource 
```

## Constructors

|  Constructor | Modifiers | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [(constructor)(dataSource, tileKey, offset, localTangentSpace)](./harp-mapview.tile._constructor_.md) |  | Creates a new \[\[Tile\]\]. |

## Properties

|  Property | Modifiers | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- | --- |
|  [allGeometryLoaded](./harp-mapview.tile.allgeometryloaded.md) |  | boolean | <code>True</code> if all geometry of the <code>Tile</code> has been loaded. |
|  [animatedExtrusionTileHandler](./harp-mapview.tile.animatedextrusiontilehandler.md) |  | [AnimatedExtrusionTileHandler](./harp-mapview.animatedextrusiontilehandler.md) \| undefined | Handler for animation of <code>Tile</code> geometries. |
|  [basicGeometryLoaded](./harp-mapview.tile.basicgeometryloaded.md) |  | boolean | <code>True</code> if the basic geometry has been loaded, and the <code>Tile</code> is ready for display. |
|  [blockingElements](./harp-mapview.tile.blockingelements.md) |  | PathBlockingElement\[\] | Get the current blocking elements. |
|  [boundingBox](./harp-mapview.tile.boundingbox.md) |  | [OrientedBox3](./harp-geoutils.orientedbox3.md) | Gets the tile's bounding box. |
|  [center](./harp-mapview.tile.center.md) |  | THREE.Vector3 | The center of this <code>Tile</code> in world coordinates. |
|  [copyrightInfo](./harp-mapview.tile.copyrightinfo.md) |  | [CopyrightInfo](./harp-mapview.copyrightinfo.md)<!-- -->\[\] | Copyright information of this <code>Tile</code>'s data. |
|  [dataSource](./harp-mapview.tile.datasource.md) |  | [DataSource](./harp-mapview.datasource.md) |  |
|  [decodedTile](./harp-mapview.tile.decodedtile.md) |  | [DecodedTile](./harp-datasource-protocol.decodedtile.md) \| undefined | Gets the decoded tile; it is removed after geometry handling. |
|  [dependencies](./harp-mapview.tile.dependencies.md) |  | string\[\] | The optional list of HERE TileKeys of tiles with geometries that cross the boundaries of this <code>Tile</code>. |
|  [disposed](./harp-mapview.tile.disposed.md) |  | boolean | Returns <code>true</code> if this <code>Tile</code> has been disposed. |
|  [frameNumLastRequested](./harp-mapview.tile.framenumlastrequested.md) |  | number | Keeping some stats for the individual \[\[Tile\]\]s to analyze caching behavior.<!-- -->The frame the \[\[Tile\]\] was last requested. This is required to know when the given \[\[Tile\]\] can be removed from the cache. |
|  [frameNumLastVisible](./harp-mapview.tile.framenumlastvisible.md) |  | number | The last frame this <code>Tile</code> has been rendered (or was in the visible set). Used to determine visibility of <code>Tile</code> at the end of a frame, if the number is the current frame number, it is visible. |
|  [frameNumVisible](./harp-mapview.tile.framenumvisible.md) |  | number | The frame the <code>Tile</code> was first visible. |
|  [geoBox](./harp-mapview.tile.geobox.md) |  | [GeoBox](./harp-geoutils.geobox.md) | The bounding box of this <code>Tile</code> in geocoordinates. |
|  [hasGeometry](./harp-mapview.tile.hasgeometry.md) |  | boolean | MapView checks if this <code>Tile</code> is ready to be rendered while culling.<!-- -->By default, MapView checks if the \[\[objects\]\] list is not empty. However, you can override this check by manually setting this property. |
|  [isVisible](./harp-mapview.tile.isvisible.md) |  | boolean | The visibility status of the \[\[Tile\]\]. It is actually visible or planned to become visible. |
|  [levelOffset](./harp-mapview.tile.leveloffset.md) |  | number | Used to tell if the Tile is used temporarily as a fallback tile.<!-- -->levelOffset is in in the range \[-quadTreeSearchDistanceUp, quadTreeSearchDistanceDown\], where these values come from the \[\[VisibleTileSetOptions\]\] |
|  [localTangentSpace](./harp-mapview.tile.localtangentspace.md) |  | boolean | Whether the data of this tile is in local tangent space or not. If the data is in local tangent space (i.e. up vector is (0,0,1) for high zoomlevels) then \[\[MapView\]\] will rotate the objects before rendering using the rotation matrix of the oriented \[\[boundingBox\]\]. |
|  [mapView](./harp-mapview.tile.mapview.md) |  | [MapView](./harp-mapview.mapview.md) | The \[\[MapView\]\] this <code>Tile</code> belongs to. |
|  [memoryUsage](./harp-mapview.tile.memoryusage.md) |  | number |  |
|  [numFramesVisible](./harp-mapview.tile.numframesvisible.md) |  | number | After removing from cache, this is the number of frames the <code>Tile</code> was visible. |
|  [objects](./harp-mapview.tile.objects.md) |  | [TileObject](./harp-mapview.tileobject.md)<!-- -->\[\] | A list of the THREE.js objects stored in this <code>Tile</code>. |
|  [offset](./harp-mapview.tile.offset.md) |  | number | The optional offset, this is an integer which represents what multiple of 360 degrees to shift, only useful for flat projections, hence optional. |
|  [preparedTextPaths](./harp-mapview.tile.preparedtextpaths.md) |  | [TextPathGeometry](./harp-datasource-protocol.textpathgeometry.md)<!-- -->\[\] \| undefined | Prepared text geometries optimized for display. |
|  [projection](./harp-mapview.tile.projection.md) |  | [Projection](./harp-geoutils.projection.md) | The \[\[Projection\]\] currently used by the \[\[MapView\]\]. |
|  [skipRendering](./harp-mapview.tile.skiprendering.md) |  | boolean | If the tile should not be rendered, this is used typically when the tile in question is completely covered by another tile and therefore can be skipped without any visual impact. Setting this value directly affects the \[\[willRender\]\] method, unless overriden by deriving classes. |
|  [textElementsChanged](./harp-mapview.tile.textelementschanged.md) |  | boolean | Gets the current modification state for the list of \[\[TextElement\]\]s in the <code>Tile</code>. If the value is <code>true</code> the TextElement is placed for rendering during the next frame. |
|  [textStyleCache](./harp-mapview.tile.textstylecache.md) |  | TileTextStyleCache | Text style cache for this tile.  |
|  [tileGeometryLoader](./harp-mapview.tile.tilegeometryloader.md) |  | TileGeometryLoader \| undefined | Gets the \[\[TileGeometryLoader\]\] that manages this tile. |
|  [tileKey](./harp-mapview.tile.tilekey.md) |  | [TileKey](./harp-geoutils.tilekey.md) |  |
|  [tileLoader](./harp-mapview.tile.tileloader.md) |  | [ITileLoader](./harp-mapview.itileloader.md) \| undefined | Gets the \[\[ITileLoader\]\] that manages this tile. |
|  [uniqueKey](./harp-mapview.tile.uniquekey.md) |  | number | Gets the key to uniquely represent this tile (based on the \[\[tileKey\]\] and \[\[offset\]\]), note this key is only unique within the given \[\[DataSource\]\], to get a key which is unique across \[\[DataSource\]\]s see \[\[DataSourceCache.getKeyForTile\]\]. |
|  [visibilityCounter](./harp-mapview.tile.visibilitycounter.md) |  | number | Version stamp of the visibility set in the \[\[TileManager\]\]. If the counter is different, the visibility of the Tile's objects has to be calculated. Optimization to reduce overhead of computing visibility. |
|  [visibleArea](./harp-mapview.tile.visiblearea.md) |  | number | Estimated visible area of tile used for sorting the priorities during loading. |

## Methods

|  Method | Modifiers | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [addBlockingElement(blockingElement)](./harp-mapview.tile.addblockingelement.md) |  | Adds a \[\[PathBlockingElement\]\] to this <code>Tile</code>. This path has the highest priority and blocks all other labels. There maybe in future a use case to give it a priority, but as that isn't yet required, it is left to be implemented later if required. |
|  [addOwnedTexture(texture)](./harp-mapview.tile.addownedtexture.md) |  | Add ownership of a texture to this tile. The texture will be disposed if the <code>Tile</code> is disposed. |
|  [addTextElement(textElement)](./harp-mapview.tile.addtextelement.md) |  | Adds a \[\[TextElement\]\] to this <code>Tile</code>, which is added to the visible set of \[\[TextElement\]\]s based on the capacity and visibility. The \[\[TextElement\]\]'s priority controls if or when it becomes visible.<!-- -->To ensure that a TextElement is visible, use a high value for its priority, such as <code>TextElement.HIGHEST_PRIORITY</code>. Since the number of visible TextElements is limited by the screen space, not all TextElements are visible at all times. |
|  [addUserTextElement(textElement)](./harp-mapview.tile.addusertextelement.md) |  | Adds a developer-defined \[\[TextElement\]\] to this <code>Tile</code>. The \[\[TextElement\]\] is always visible, if it's in the map's currently visible area. |
|  [clear()](./harp-mapview.tile.clear.md) |  | Frees the rendering resources allocated by this <code>Tile</code>.<!-- -->The default implementation of this method frees the geometries and the materials for all the reachable objects. Textures are freed if they are owned by this <code>Tile</code> (i.e. if they where created by this <code>Tile</code>or if the ownership was explicitely set to this <code>Tile</code> by \[\[addOwnedTexture\]\]). |
|  [clearTextElements()](./harp-mapview.tile.cleartextelements.md) |  | Removes all \[\[TextElement\]\] from the tile. |
|  [computeWorldOffsetX()](./harp-mapview.tile.computeworldoffsetx.md) |  | Computes the offset in the x world coordinates corresponding to this tile, based on its \[\[offset\]\]. |
|  [didRender()](./harp-mapview.tile.didrender.md) |  | Called after \[\[MapView\]\] has rendered this <code>Tile</code>. |
|  [dispose()](./harp-mapview.tile.dispose.md) |  | Disposes this <code>Tile</code>, freeing all geometries and materials for the reachable objects. |
|  [forceHasGeometry(value)](./harp-mapview.tile.forcehasgeometry.md) |  | Overrides the default value for \[\[hasGeometry\]\] if value is not <code>undefined</code>. |
|  [getResourceInfo()](./harp-mapview.tile.getresourceinfo.md) |  | Compute \[\[TileResourceInfo\]\] of this <code>Tile</code>. May be using a cached value. The method <code>invalidateResourceInfo</code> can be called beforehand to force a recalculation. |
|  [hasTextElements()](./harp-mapview.tile.hastextelements.md) |  | Returns true if the <code>Tile</code> has any text elements to render. |
|  [invalidateResourceInfo()](./harp-mapview.tile.invalidateresourceinfo.md) |  | Force invalidation of the cached \[\[TileResourceInfo\]\]. Useful after the <code>Tile</code> has been modified. |
|  [load()](./harp-mapview.tile.load.md) |  | Loads this <code>Tile</code> geometry. |
|  [loadingFinished()](./harp-mapview.tile.loadingfinished.md) |  | Called by the \[\[TileLoader\]\] after the <code>Tile</code> has finished loading its map data. Can be used to add content to the <code>Tile</code>. The \[\[DecodedTile\]\] should still be available. |
|  [removeDecodedTile()](./harp-mapview.tile.removedecodedtile.md) |  | Remove the decodedTile when no longer needed. |
|  [removeTextElement(textElement)](./harp-mapview.tile.removetextelement.md) |  | Removes a \[\[TextElement\]\] from this <code>Tile</code>. For the element to be removed successfully, the priority of the \[\[TextElement\]\] has to be equal to its priority when it was added. |
|  [removeUserTextElement(textElement)](./harp-mapview.tile.removeusertextelement.md) |  | Removes a developer-defined \[\[TextElement\]\] from this <code>Tile</code>. |
|  [resetVisibilityCounter()](./harp-mapview.tile.resetvisibilitycounter.md) |  | Reset the visibility counter. This will force the visibility check to be rerun on all objects in this <code>Tile</code>. |
|  [shouldDisposeObjectGeometry(object)](./harp-mapview.tile.shoulddisposeobjectgeometry.md) |  | Called when the default implementation of <code>dispose()</code> needs to free the geometry of a <code>Tile</code> object. |
|  [shouldDisposeObjectMaterial(object)](./harp-mapview.tile.shoulddisposeobjectmaterial.md) |  | Called when the default implementation of <code>dispose()</code> needs to free a <code>Tile</code> object's material. |
|  [shouldDisposeTexture(texture)](./harp-mapview.tile.shoulddisposetexture.md) |  | Called when the default implementation of <code>dispose()</code> needs to free a Texture that is part of a <code>Tile</code> object's material. |
|  [update(zoomLevel)](./harp-mapview.tile.update.md) |  | Update tile for current map view zoom level |
|  [willRender(\_zoomLevel)](./harp-mapview.tile.willrender.md) |  | Called before \[\[MapView\]\] starts rendering this <code>Tile</code>. |
